maml:description.maml:para: Decommissions the specified Publication Target.
The Clear-TcmPublicationTarget cmdlet decommissions specified Publication Target.
Sets TcmUri(s) of the one or more Publication Targets to decommission.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Sets TcmUri(s) of the one or more Publication Targets to decommission.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Gets a list of all SDL Web Content Manager application IDs for all application data stored in the system.
The Get-TcmApplicationIds cmdlet gets all SDL Web Content Manager application IDs for all application data stored in the system.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
A collection of string values representing all application IDs.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all SDL Web Content Manager application IDs for all application data stored in the system. If there are no application data stored in the system, this command returns to the command prompt without displaying anything.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets specific Publish Transaction or filtered list of Publish Transactions from the system.
Gets specific Publish Transaction if Id parameter is specified. Otherwise, gets filtered or unfiltered list of Publish Transactions.
TCM URI of the PublishTransaction.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Optional. When specified, gets only those Publish Transactions which handling host name starts with this value.

Optional. If true, gets only those Publish Transactions which are in one of the final states: Success, Failed, Warning, Undone, UndoFailed. If false, gets only those Publish Transactions which are not in one of the final state.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
TCM URI of the PublishTransaction.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Optional. When specified, gets only those Publish Transactions which handling host name starts with this value.

Optional. If true, gets only those Publish Transactions which are in one of the final states: Success, Failed, Warning, Undone, UndoFailed. If false, gets only those Publish Transactions which are not in one of the final state.

maml:alert.maml:para: User that has PublishManagement right in any publication or has administrative privilege can see Publish Transactions from all publications.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of all SDL Web Content Manager queues.
The Get-TcmQueueInfo cmdlet gets all queues which are configured in the SDL Web Content Manager.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Gets the repositories from the system. If Ids are not specified then all repositories will be returned.
The cmdlet Get-TcmRepository gets the repositories from the system. If Ids are not specified then all repositories will be returned.
Specifies one or more repository by id.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Specifies one or more repository by id.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
List of Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.RepositoryData objects. RepositoryData represents the data of a Repository.
Deletes all application data from the system for the specified application identifier.

The Remove-TcmApplicationData allows to delete all application data from the system for the specified application identifiers. It operates on the local Content Manager installation and under current operating system user. User must be System Administrator, if not - PermissionDenied exception will occur. You need to confirm an execution of this operation.
Application identifiers for which purging application data process must be preformed.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Application identifiers for which purging application data process must be preformed.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
You can pipe a string array that contains Application identifiers for which purging application data process must be performed.

maml:alert.maml:para: Deletes all (global and subject related) application data for a given application ID. Typical usecase of this method is a clean up of all application data left by some application which was uninstalled.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes all (global and subject related) application data for the "cme:UserPreferences" application ID. This command returns to the command prompt without displaying anything.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes SDL Web Content Manager batches

The Remove-TcmBatches cmdlet allows to remove SDL Web Content Manager Batches. If User is System Administrator he can purge all batches, otherwise only his own bathes. You need to confirm an execution of this operation.
If -All switch is specified, it will delete all batches, otherwise only completed.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
If -All switch is specified, it will delete all batches, otherwise only completed.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Represents data of a Batch. Defines batch operations and additional info related to batch invocation.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes all SDL Web Content Manager Batches.

maml:description.maml:para: Purges old versions of SDL Web Content Manager items.

The Remove-TcmItemsOldVersions cmdlet allows to remove old versions of items from the Content Manager database based on criteria's specified in parameters. Cmdlet scans and purges versions of the following types of Content Manager items: Components, Component Templates, Pages Page Templates, Schemas, Template Building Blocks. Cmdlet never deletes: versions of items that are currently checked out, the current (latest) version of an item. User must be System Administrator, if not - PermissionDenied exception will occur. You need to confirm an execution of this operation.
List of publication or/and organizational item identifiers (TCM URI or WebDAV URL) in which a purging process will be performed.
The number of most recent versions to keep. Note that the current version is always kept.
The date before which all versions are purged.
Versions created during the specified number of days from now (backward) are kept.
If it is specified, the purge will be performed in nested organizational items, otherwise not.
The maximum number of versioned items which we can select for purging.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
List of publication or/and organizational item identifiers (TCM URI or WebDAV URL) in which a purging process will be performed.
The number of most recent versions to keep. Note that the current version is always kept.
The date before which all versions are purged.
Versions created during the specified number of days from now (backward) are kept.
If it is specified, the purge will be performed in nested organizational items, otherwise not.
The maximum number of versioned items which we can select for purging.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
The count of purged versions.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove all items from tcm:0-8-1 and tcm:0-37-1 and nested organizational items. Keep only two last versions.

maml:description.maml:para: Purges old Workflow Process History items.

To delete process histories after a specific date, put the date in the -Before parameter. If it is not specified - purge process will be performed for all process history items. To delete process histories from specific publication, put publication id in the -PublicationId parameter. If it is not specified - purge process will be performed for all process history items. An executed command returns ProcessHistoryData objects of deleted items one-by-one. User must be System Administrator, if not - PermissionDenied exception will occur. You need to confirm an execution of this operation.
Determines a date before which process histories will be purged. If it is not specified - the purge process will be performed for all process histories items.
Determines publication where process histories will be purged. If it is not specified - the purge process will be performed for all process histories items.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Determines a date before which process histories will be purged. If it is not specified - the purge process will be performed for all process histories items.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Determines publication where process histories will be purged. If it is not specified - the purge process will be performed for all process histories items.
Representing data of TCM Process History.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove all process histories items that are finished before 02.06.2012

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes SDL Web Content Management Publish Transactions

The Remove-TcmPublishTransactions cmdlet allows to delete finished SDL Web Content Management PublishTransaction objects. You can specify the parameters to constraint purging process, if no parameter is specified then all finished transactions will be purged. To purge publication transactions that have finished successfully, use -Successful switch. To purge publish transactions that did not finish successfully, use -Failed switch. To specify the date before which the publish transactions will be purged, use -Before parameter. If User is System Administrator he can purge all finished Publish Transaction items, otherwise only his own items. Command execution returns Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PublishTransactionData objects of deleted items one-by-one. You need to confirm an execution of this operation.
If this switch is specified, the deleting will occur for successful transactions.
If this switch is specified, the deleting will occur for failed transactions.
Delete publish transactions that were completed before this date, if it is not specified - a purge process will be performed for all publish transactions
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
If this switch is specified, the deleting will occur for successful transactions.
If this switch is specified, the deleting will occur for failed transactions.
Delete publish transactions that were completed before this date, if it is not specified - a purge process will be performed for all publish transactions
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Represents the data object of a PublishTransaction.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes all publish transactions finished before 20.07.12. If there are no publish transactions which were finished before 20.07.12, this command returns to the command prompt without displaying anything.

maml:description.maml:para: Purges specified (or all if not) SDL Web Content Manager queues (Search, Publish, Workflow Agent, Deploy, Batch) messages.

The Remove-TcmQueueMessages cmdlet deletes messages from the Publish Queue, Deploy Queue, Search Queue, Batch Queue and/or Workflow Queue. You can use the parameter of this cmdlet to specify queues, if not specified - purging process will be performed for all queues. User must be System Administrator, if not - PermissionDenied exception will occur. You need to confirm an execution of this operation.

Specifies the list of a Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PredefinedQueue enum for which will be performed purging process, if not specified - the purging process will be performed for all queues.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.

Specifies the list of a Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PredefinedQueue enum for which will be performed purging process, if not specified - the purging process will be performed for all queues.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
You can pipe a string array that contains Tridion.ContentManager.CoreService.Client.PredefinedQueue enum items (value or name) for which purging process must be performed.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove all QueueMessages items related to PublishQueue and WorkflowAgentQueue.

maml:description.maml:para: Synchronizes (part of) the SDL Web Content Manager full-text index.
The cmdlet Sync-TcmSearchIndex synchronizes (part of) the SDL Web Content Manager full-text index.
Repository identifiers for which full-text index synchronization must be performed. If no identifier is specified then full synchronization will be performed.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Repository identifiers for which full-text index synchronization must be performed. If no identifier is specified then full synchronization will be performed.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
Gets a list of all undo packages stored in the system's application data.
Undo packages can be stored either on the local file system (by default) or in application data in the scaled out scenario. This cmdlet shows only packages stored in application data.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
List of objects with metadata about undo packages that includes package ID, creation date, number of actions to undo, TCM URI of the user who performed import, import description.

maml:alert.maml:para: In order to enable storing undo packages in application data, add useBinaryContentProvider="true" to the importExport section in the Tridion.ContentManager.config.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Outputs list of packages as a readable table.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes undo packages stored in the system's application data.

Removes one or more undo packages stored in the system's application data. Undo packages can be stored either on the local file system (by default) or in application data in the scaled out scenario. This cmdlet removes only packages stored in application data.
The date before which all undo packages are removed.
Undo package ID to remove single specific package.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.
The date before which all undo packages are removed.
Undo package ID to remove single specific package.
The TCM server name of the remote server. It will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
The Port on which net.tcp endpoint is hosted. Default value is 2660. This value will be used as part of the CoreService URL net.tcp://{Server}:{Port}/CoreService/{Endpoint}
Sets the send and receive timeout (in minutes) of the Core Service NetTcp endpoint.

maml:alert.maml:para: In order to enable storing undo packages in application data, add useBinaryContentProvider="true" to the importExport section in the Tridion.ContentManager.config.
